content: quote: Originally posted by GunnyRet03: quote: Originally posted by mcgreer: quote: Originally posted by EAG154: Easy to be popular when you drive down the road throwing money at people How did we get here? Let me guess: Jimmy Carter. LOL When the next adm comes in and we are still at the same place, we'll see if you say that if a rebub is on office. Whatever you say about the last Adm's spending that last 90 days have made them look like neophytes in that realm. Budgets go up every year, Gunny. And the difference between the projected 2010 budget and last year's is not that much if you check the facts. What makes this one so different is what I consider manufactured outrage over the projected spending against the current deficit has placed a marker that we haven't dealt with in quite a few years. Again, looking at that, there isn't a whole lot of difference between what we've been doing over the past several years - unless you're a partisan who's looking for blame or excuses (depending on what side of the fence one stands). I also find it amusing that, while a majority of Americans aren't satisified with the "direction of the country", the numbers have improved over the past three months. So, actually, fewer people are dissatisfied.
